sen2mosaic package¶

Submodules¶

sen2mosaic.L1C module¶

sen2mosaic.L1C.connectToAPI(username, password)[source]¶

Connect to the SciHub API with sentinelsat.

Parameters:
  • username – Scihub username. Sign up at https://scihub.copernicus.eu/.
  • password – Scihub password.
sen2mosaic.L1C.decompress(tile, dataloc = os.getcwd(), remove = False)[source]¶

Decompresses .zip files downloaded from SciHub, and optionally removes original .zip file.

Parameters:
  • tile – A string containing the name of the tile to to download.
  • dataloc – The directory of level 1C Sentinel-2 .SAFE files. Defaults to current working directory.
  • remove – Boolean value, which when set to True deletes level 1C .zip files after decompression is complete. Defaults to False.
sen2mosaic.L1C.download(products_df, output_dir = os.getcwd())[source]¶

Downloads all images from a dataframe produced by sentinelsat.

Parameters:
  • products_df – Pandas dataframe from search() function.
  • output_dir – Optionally specify an output directory. Defaults to the present working directory.
sen2mosaic.L1C.main(username, password, tile, start = '20161206', end = datetime.datetime.today().strftime('%Y%m%d'), maxcloud = 100, output_dir = os.getcwd(), remove = False)[source]¶

Download Sentinel-2 data from the Copernicus Open Access Hub, specifying a particular tile, date ranges and degrees of cloud cover.

Parameters:
  • username – Scihub username. Sign up at https://scihub.copernicus.eu/.
  • password – Scihub password.
  • tile – A string containing the name of the tile to to download.
  • start – Start date for search in format YYYYMMDD. Start date may not precede 20161206, the date where the format of Sentinel-2 files was simplified. Defaults to 20161206.
  • end – End date for search in format YYYYMMDD. Defaults to today’s date.
  • maxcloud – An integer of maximum percentage of cloud cover to download. Defaults to 100 %% (download all images, regardless of cloud cover).
  • output_dir – Optionally specify an output directory. Defaults to the present working directory.
  • remove – Boolean value, which when set to True deletes level 1C .zip files after decompression is complete. Defaults to False.
sen2mosaic.L1C.search(tile, start = '20161206', end = datetime.datetime.today().strftime('%Y%m%d'), maxcloud = 100)[source]¶

Searches for images from a single Sentinel-2 Granule that meet conditions of date range and cloud cover.

Parameters:
  • tile – A string containing the name of the tile to to download.
  • start – Start date for search in format YYYYMMDD. Start date may not precede 20161206, the date where the format of Sentinel-2 files was simplified. Defaults to 20161206.
  • end – End date for search in format YYYYMMDD. Defaults to today’s date.
  • maxcloud – An integer of maximum percentage of cloud cover to download. Defaults to 100 %% (download all images, regardless of cloud cover).
Returns:

A pandas dataframe with details of scenes matching conditions.

sen2mosaic.L2A module¶

sen2mosaic.L2A.improveMask(jp2, res)[source]¶
Tweaks the cloud mask output from sen2cor. Processes are:
  1. Changing ‘dark features’ to ‘cloud shadows.
  2. Dilating ‘cloud shadows’, ‘medium probability cloud’ and ‘high probability cloud’ by 180 m.
  3. Eroding outer 3 km of the tile to improve stitching of images by sen2Three.
Parameters:
  • jp2 – A glymur .jp2 file from loadMask().
  • res – Integer of resolution to be processed (i.e. 10 m, 20 m, 60 m).
Returns:

A numpy array of the SCL mask with modifications.
sen2mosaic.L2A.loadMask(L2A_file, res)[source]¶

Load classification mask given .SAFE file and resolution.

Parameters:
  • L2A_file – A level 2A Sentinel-2 .SAFE file, processed with sen2cor.
  • res – Integer of resolution to be processed (i.e. 10 m, 20 m, 60 m).
Returns:

A glymur .jp2 file the path to the classified image. The directory location of the .jp2 mask file.
sen2mosaic.L2A.main(infile, gipp=None, output_dir=None, remove=False)[source]¶

Function to initiate sen2cor on level 1C Sentinel-2 files and perform improvements to cloud masking.

Parameters:
  • infile – A level 1C Sentinel-2 .SAFE file.
  • gipp – Optionally specify a copy of the L2A_GIPP.xml file in order to specify the output location.
  • output_dir – Optionally specify an output directory. The option gipp must also be specified if you use this option.
  • remove – Boolean value, which when set to True deletes level 1C files after processing is complete. Defaults to False.
sen2mosaic.L2A.processToL2A(infile, gipp=None, output_dir=None)[source]¶

Processes Sentinel-2 level 1C files to level L2A with sen2cor.

Parameters:
  • infile – A level 1C Sentinel-2 .SAFE file.
  • gipp – Optionally specify a copy of the L2A_GIPP.xml file in order to specify the output location.
  • output_dir – Optionally specify an output directory. The option gipp must also be specified if you use this option.
Returns:

Absolute file path to the output file.
sen2mosaic.L2A.removeL1C(L1C_file)[source]¶

Deletes a Level 1C Sentinel-2 .SAFE file from disk.

Parameters:L1C_file – A Sentinel-2 level 1C file.
sen2mosaic.L2A.writeMask(jp2, data, image_path)[source]¶

Overwrites the old SCL mask with a new one, preserving the metadata (including projection info) from the original .jp2 file.

Parameters:
  • jp2 – A glymur jp2 file of the original SCL mask.
  • data – A numpy array containing the new data to overwrite the old mask with.
  • image_path – The path to the original classified image.

sen2mosaic.L3A module¶

sen2mosaic.L3A.main(input_dir = os.getcwd(), remove = False)[source]¶

Process level 2A Sentinel-2 data from sen2cor to cloud free mosaics with sen2three. This script initiates sen2three from within Python.

Parameters:
  • input_dir – Directory containing level 2A Sentinel-2 .SAFE files. Defaults to current working directory.
  • remove – Boolean value, which when set to True deletes level 2A files after processing is complete. Defaults to False.
sen2mosaic.L3A.processToL3A(input_dir)[source]¶

Processes Sentinel-2 level 2A files to level 3A with sen2three.

Parameters:input_dir – Directory containing level 2A Sentinel-2 .SAFE files. Directory must contain files from only one single tile.
sen2mosaic.L3A.remove2A(input_dir)[source]¶

Function to remove all Sentinel-2 level 2A files from a directory. Directory must contain files from only one single tile.

Parameters:input_dir – Directory containing level 2A Sentinel-2 .SAFE files.

sen2mosaic.L3B module¶

sen2mosaic.L3B.buildMetadataDictionary(extent_dest, res, EPSG)[source]¶

Build a metadata dictionary to describe the destination georeference info

Parameters:
  • extent_dest – List desciribing corner coordinate points in destination CRS [xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax]
  • res – Integer describing pixel size in m (10, 20, or 60)
  • EPSG – EPSG code of destination coordinate reference system. Must be a UTM projection. See: https://www.epsg-registry.org/ for codes.
Returns:

A dictionary containg projection info.
sen2mosaic.L3B.buildVRT(red_band, green_band, blue_band, output_path)[source]¶

Builds a three band RGB vrt for image visualisation. Outputs a .VRT file.

Parameters:
  • red_band – Filename to add to red band
  • green_band – Filename to add to green band
  • blue_band – Filename to add to blue band
  • output_name – Path to output file
sen2mosaic.L3B.generateBandArray(source_files, image_n, band, scl_out, md_dest, output_dir=os.getcwd(), output_name='L3B_output')[source]¶

Function which generates an output GeoTiff file from list of level 3B source files for a specified output band and extent.

Parameters:
  • source_files – A list of level 3A input files.
  • image_n – An array of integers from generateSCLArray(), which describes the source_file that each pixel should come from. 0 = No data, 1 = first source_file, 2 = second source_file etc.
  • band – String describing bad to process. e.g. B02, B03, B8A....
  • scl_out – Numpy array with mask from generateSCLArray().
  • md_dest – Dictionary from buildMetaDataDictionary() containing output projection details.
  • output_dir – Optionally specify directory for output file. Defaults to current working directory.
  • output_name – Optionally specify a string to prepend to output files. Defaults to ‘L3B_output’.
Returns:

A numpy array containing mosaic data for the input band.
sen2mosaic.L3B.generateSCLArray(source_files, md_dest, output_dir = os.getcwd(), output_name = 'L3B_output')[source]¶

Function which generates an mask GeoTiff file from list of level 3B source files for a specified output band and extent, and an array desciribing which source_image each pixel comes from

Parameters:
  • source_files – A list of level 3A input files.
  • md_dest – Dictionary from buildMetaDataDictionary() containing output projection details.
  • output_dir – Optionally specify directory for output file. Defaults to current working directory.
  • output_name – Optionally specify a string to prepend to output files. Defaults to ‘L3B_output’.
Returns:

A numpy array containing mosaic data for the input band. A numpy array describing the image number each pixel is sourced from. 0 = No data, 1 = first source_file, 2 = second source_file etc.
sen2mosaic.L3B.getSafeFilesInTile(source_files, md_dest)[source]¶

Takes a list of source files as input, and determines where each falls within extent of output tile.

Parameters:
  • source_files – A list of level 3A input files.
  • md_dest – Dictionary from buildMetaDataDictionary() containing output projection details.
Returns:

A reduced list of source_files containing only files that will contribute to each tile.
sen2mosaic.L3B.getSourceMetadata(safe_file, res)[source]¶

Function to extract georefence info from level 3 Sentinel 2 data in .SAFE format.

Parameters:
  • safe_file – String with /path/to/the/MTD_TL.xml file bundled with a .SAFE file.
  • res – Integer describing pixel size in m (10, 20, or 60).
Returns:

A list describing the extent of the .SAFE file, in the format [xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax]. EPSG code of the coordinate reference system of the .SAFE file.
sen2mosaic.L3B.main(source_files, extent_dest, EPSG_dest, res_list = [10, 10, 10, 10, 20, 20, 20, 20, 20, 20], band_list = ['B02','B03','B04','B08','B05','B06','B07','B8A','B11','B12'], output_dir = os.getcwd(), output_name = 'L3B_output')[source]¶

Function to run through the entire chain for converting output of sen2Three into custom mosaics.

Parameters:
  • source_files – A list of level 3A input files.
  • extent_dest – List desciribing corner coordinate points in destination CRS [xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax].
  • EPSG_dest – EPSG code of destination coordinate reference system. Must be a UTM projection. See: https://www.epsg-registry.org/ for codes.
  • res_list – Optionally specify a list of integers describing pixel size in m (10, 20, or 60). Must be accompanied by a band_list of the same size. Defaults to native resolution of each band.
  • band_list – Optionally specify a list of output band names. Must be accompanied by a res_list of the same size. Defaults to processing all 10 and 20 m bands.
  • output_dir – Optionally specify an output directory.
  • output_name – Optionally specify a string to precede output file names.
